alert.note: Alert for Callahan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Callahan County through 1000 PM CDT... At 908 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eula, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clyde around 915 PM CDT. Baird around 930 PM CDT. Putnam around 955 PM CDT. Atwell around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Admiral and I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 293 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
